item.title: Facebook discloses FreeType 2 flaw exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Facebook is warning that a FreeType vulnerability in all versions up to 2.13 can lead to arbitrary code execution, with reports that the flaw has been exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: CISA: Medusa ransomware hit over 300 critical infrastructure orgs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA says the Medusa ransomware operation has impacted over 300 organizations in critical infrastructure sectors in the United States until last month. [...]

item.title: New North Korean Android spyware slips onto Google Play
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android spyware named 'KoSpy' is linked to North Korean threat actors who have infiltrated Google Play and third-party app store APKPure through at least five malicious apps. [...]

item.title: Garantex crypto exchange admin arrested while on vacation
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Indian authorities arrested Aleksej Besciokov, the co-founder and one of the administrators of the Russian Garantex crypto-exchange while vacationing with his family in Varkala, India. [...]

item.title: Mozilla warns users to update Firefox before certificate expires
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Mozilla is warning Firefox users to update their browsers to the latest version to avoid facing disruption and security risks caused by the upcoming expiration of one of the company's root certificates. [...]

item.title: Microsoft patches Windows Kernel zero-day exploited since 2023
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Slovak cybersecurity company ESET says a newly patched zero-day vulnerability in the Windows Win32 Kernel Subsystem has been exploited in attacks since March 2023. [...]

item.title: Browser-Based Data Leaks: 3 Biggest Data Security Challenges Today
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Keep Aware
item.description: Traditional Data Loss Prevention (DLP) solutions weren't built for today's browser-driven workplace. Now sensitive data moves moves through SaaS apps, AI tools, and personal accounts, bypassing legacy security controls. Learn from Keep Aware how real-time browser security can stop data leaks before they happen. [...]

item.title: Chinese cyberspies backdoor Juniper routers for stealthy access
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Chinese hackers are deploying custom backdoors on Juniper Networks Junos OS MX routers that have reached end-of-life (EoL) and no longer receive security updates. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Recent Windows updates make USB printers print random text
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says that some USB printers will start printing random text after installing Windows updates released since late January 2025. [...]

item.title: North Korean Lazarus hackers infect hundreds via npm packages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Six malicious packages have been identified on npm (Node package manager) linked to the notorious North Korean hacking group Lazarus. [...]

item.title: Apple fixes WebKit zero-day exploited in ‘extremely sophisticated’ attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Apple has released emergency security updates to patch a zero-day bug the company describes as exploited in "extremely sophisticated" attacks. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5053606 update fixes broken SSH connections
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5053606 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, which fixes numerous bugs, including one preventing SSH connections. [...]
